definition: Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous

sentences.english: This text adopt old view also, think Divination of Confucian originate from Yan Zou spread out period.
sentences.chinese: 本文還採用了陳槃的觀點，認爲讖緯起源於鄒衍時期。

to plan and consider/to reflect on one's best strategy
School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Zou Yan 鄒衍|邹衍[Zou1 Yan3]
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to be in overall charge/to oversee

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
